verses.verse: Then answered <S%H6030><s%> Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite, <S%H7747><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>

How <S%H5704><s%> long <S%H5704><s%> will you speak <S%H4448><s%> these <S%H428><s%> things? and how long shall the words <S%H561><s%> of your mouth <S%H6310><s%> be like a strong <S%H3524><s%> wind? <S%H7307><s%>
Does God <S%H410><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> judgment? <S%H4941><s%> or does the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> pervert <S%H5791><s%> justice? <S%H6664><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> your children <S%H1121><s%> have sinned <S%H2398><s%> against him, and he have cast <S%H7971><s%> them away for their transgression; <S%H6588><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> you would seek <S%H7836><s%> to God <S%H410><s%> betimes, <S%H7836><s%> and make your supplication <S%H2603><s%> to the Almighty; <S%H7706><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> you were pure <S%H2134><s%> and upright; <S%H3477><s%> surely <S%H3588><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> he would awake <S%H5782><s%> for you, and make the habitation <S%H5116><s%> of your righteousness <S%H6664><s%> prosperous. <S%H7999><s%>
Though your beginning <S%H7225><s%> was small, <S%H4705><s%> yet your latter <S%H319><s%> end should greatly <S%H3966><s%> increase. <S%H7685><s%>
For inquire, <S%H7592><s%> I pray <S%H4994><s%> you, of the former <S%H7223><s%> age, <S%H1755><s%> and prepare <S%H3559><s%> yourself to the search <S%H2714><s%> of their fathers: <S%H1><s%>
(For we are but of yesterday, <S%H8543><s%> and know <S%H3045><s%> nothing, <S%H3808><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> our days <S%H3117><s%> on earth <S%H776><s%> are a shadow: <S%H6738><s%>)
Shall not they teach <S%H3384><s%> you, and tell <S%H559><s%> you, and utter <S%H3318><s%> words <S%H4405><s%> out of their heart? <S%H3820><s%>
Can the rush <S%H1573><s%> grow <S%H1342><s%> up without <S%H3808><s%> mire? <S%H1207><s%> can the flag <S%H260><s%> grow <S%H1342><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> water? <S%H4325><s%>
Whilst it is yet <S%H5750><s%> in his greenness, <S%H3><s%> and not cut <S%H6998><s%> down, it wither <S%H3001><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> other herb. <S%H2682><s%>
So <S%H3651><s%> are the paths <S%H734><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> that forget <S%H7911><s%> God; <S%H410><s%> and the hypocrite's <S%H2611><s%> hope <S%H8615><s%> shall perish: <S%H6><s%>
Whose <S%H834><s%> hope <S%H3689><s%> shall be cut <S%H6990><s%> off, and whose trust <S%H4009><s%> shall be a spider's <S%H5908><s%> web. <S%H1004><s%>
He shall lean <S%H8172><s%> on his house, <S%H1004><s%> but it shall not stand: <S%H5975><s%> he shall hold <S%H2388><s%> it fast, but it shall not endure. <S%H6965><s%>
He is green <S%H7373><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the sun, <S%H8121><s%> and his branch <S%H3127><s%> shoots <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> in his garden. <S%H1593><s%>
His roots <S%H8328><s%> are wrapped <S%H5440><s%> about <S%H5440><s%> the heap, <S%H1530><s%> and sees <S%H2372><s%> the place <S%H1004><s%> of stones. <S%H68><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> he destroy <S%H1104><s%> him from his place, <S%H4725><s%> then it shall deny <S%H3584><s%> him, saying, I have not seen <S%H7200><s%> you.
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> this <S%H1931><s%> is the joy <S%H4885><s%> of his way, <S%H1870><s%> and out of the earth <S%H6083><s%> shall others <S%H312><s%> grow. <S%H6779><s%>
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> God <S%H410><s%> will not cast <S%H3988><s%> away a perfect <S%H8535><s%> man, neither <S%H3808><s%> will he help <S%H2388><s%> the evil <S%H7489><s%> doers:
Till <S%H5704><s%> he fill <S%H4390><s%> your mouth <S%H6310><s%> with laughing, <S%H7814><s%> and your lips <S%H8193><s%> with rejoicing. <S%H8643><s%>
They that hate <S%H8130><s%> you shall be clothed <S%H3847><s%> with shame; <S%H1322><s%> and the dwelling <S%H168><s%> place of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall come to nothing. <S%H369><s%>
